title: Giau Pass
text:
The Giau Pass () (<a href="Ladin%20language">Ladin</a>: "Jof de Giau") (el. 2236 m.) is a high <a href="mountain%20pass">mountain pass</a> in the <a href="Dolomites">Dolomites</a> in the province of <a href="Belluno">Belluno</a> in <a href="Italy">Italy</a>. It connects <a href="Cortina%20d%27Ampezzo">Cortina d'Ampezzo</a> with <a href="Colle%20Santa%20Lucia">Colle Santa Lucia</a> and <a href="Selva%20di%20Cadore">Selva di Cadore</a>.
It is located at the center of a vast mountain pasture at the foot of Nuvolau (2,574 m) and dell'<a href="Averau">Averau</a> (2,647 m) from which you can easily reach the Monte Pore (2,405 m). Impressive is the view west towards <a href="Colle%20Santa%20Lucia">Colle Santa Lucia</a> with the <a href="Pala%20group">Pale di San Martino</a>, Cime D'Auta, <a href="Marmolada">Marmolada</a>, <a href="Piz%20Bo%C3%A8">Piz Boe</a> and Setsass, just to the east towards the valley of <a href="Cortina%20d%27Ampezzo">Cortina d'Ampezzo</a>, with <a href="Tofane">Tofane</a>, Croda Rossa, <a href="Pomagagnon">Pomagagnon</a>, <a href="Cristallo%20%28mountain%29">Cristallo</a>, <a href="Croda%20da%20Lago">Croda da Lago</a>, etc.
Accessibility and Territory.
Passo Giau is comprised in the territories of <a href="Colle%20Santa%20Lucia">Colle Santa Lucia</a>, <a href="San%20Vito%20di%20Cadore">San Vito di Cadore</a>, <a href="Cortina%20d%27Ampezzo">Cortina d'Ampezzo</a>, and <a href="Selva%20di%20Cadore">Selva di Cadore</a>. The road that goes up from Selva di Cadore has 29 tornanti and 3 tunnels for protection against avalanches, while the side towards Cortina is more easily passable. It is an interesting alternative to get to Cortina from Agordino area also because the road of Passo Giau, unlike the <a href="Falzarego%20Pass">Passo Falzarego</a> road is passable by trucks and coaches. However, despite the efforts made over the years, the winter season is often compromised by the avalanches that come down to block the uncovered parts of the road.
Mountain Huts.
Rifugio Passo Giau (2236 m) - Colle Santa Lucia
Rirugio Da Aurelio (2175 m) - Colle Santa Lucia
Rifugio Fedare (2000 m) - Colle Santa Lucia
Malga Giau (1900 m) - San Vito di Cadore
Maratona dles Dolomites bicycle race.
Since 1988 the Giau Pass is the sixth and steepest of seven Dolomites mountain passes riders cross in the annual <a href="Maratona%20dles%20Dolomites">Maratona dles Dolomites</a> single-day <a href="bicycle%20race">bicycle race</a>.
